newsitem.title: UK: OPTIONS - Short straddle traded in Railtrack.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS - Short straddle traded in Railtrack.

text.p: With many minds on the approaching long weekend, activity in UK equity options dwindled on Friday, dealers said.
But one outstanding feature was a short straddle in railway infrastructure operator Railtrack Group, owing to the sale of 1,000 December 240 puts and calls at 14p and 12p each.

The deal may have been initiated by a trader who already owns the underlying stock, so the short calls will offer some protection against a share price fall, while the short puts may help make some extra profit. The net amount depends on the number of shares held and the price paid for them.
But if the shares fall too far losses will be exaggerated owing to the combination of the long stock position plus the short puts.
If no underlying shares were held by the trader then the short straddle relies on the share price reach 240p by expiry so the puts and calls expire worthless to give a maximum profit of 26p.
Railtrack shares -- in partly paid form -- go ex-dividend by 13.75p net of basic tax on Tuesday.
By 1255 GMT, they were up 2-1/2p to 251p.
Elsewhere, in conglomerate Hanson the main deal was a crossed trade of 600 November 180 calls at 2p.
Over in British Gas, there was a buyer of 500 September puts at 4p. The shares added 1/2p to 207-1/2p and the company will announce second quarter results on September 12.
Tobacco-to-insurance group BAT Industries was lively and the biggest deal was from a buyer of 500 November 500 calls at 5-1/2p. BAT shares added 7p to 429p.
